title: Low Priority Queue Takes Longer Than Stated?
body: Well I was playing some LoL the other day with some of our friends and it turned out one of them had Low Priority (20 Mins). When we started the queue the sign came up and said "Abandoning a match or being AFK..." as well as 20:00. I went to watch some Youtube while waiting. Turns out that I spent 10 minutes on Youtube but the LoL LeaverBuster spent only around 3-4 minutes decreasing. Can somebody explain this?

replies.body: It seems that fixing these issues are a low priority.
You could say it's a low priority queue.
your friend ended the queue and then restarted it, most likely.
I'm not totally sure about that but it didn't seem so :?

There's a known issue about the low priority queue timer 'resetting' for some people, could be what you're experiencing. If that's the case then you'd need to contact Riot support about it. As far as I'm aware there isn't an easy fix but support should be able to help you if there is.
test it. put a stop watch next to it and record. if what you say is true. they messed up hard!
Hey yeah the first time i did this I actually timed it and it was acting faulty.
Timed it starting at 6:40 (Original was 10 minutes) and when the countdown ended there was still around 3 and a half minutes left on the LoL penalty.
